attributes.action: Explain what he will do to resolve Scottish MPs being able to vote on purely English/Welsh matters, given that he refuses to have either an English Parliament or to exclude Scottish MPs from English/Welsh-only votes?
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whilst I understand the reasons the Prime Minister has put forward for refusing both an English Parliament and for preventing Scottish MPs voting on purely English/Welsh matters, the Prime Minister must accept that this problem is one of his making since he created the Scottish Parliament.

Therefore if he finds the two proposed methods of resolving the "West Lothian Question", whereby Scottish MPs may vote on purely English/Welsh matters but English/Welsh MPs may not vote on purely Scottish matters (since they are now dealt with by the Scottish Parliament) to be unacceptable, it is his job both as Prime Minister and architect of the Scottish Parliament, to come up with some other solution which solves this undemocratic and unjust arrangement.

rejection.details: There are several petitions on this theme. Please consider signing an existing petition before opening a new one.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
